overwatch is that ex girlfriend you had that lasted like 3 years but had to cut off cause she started some bad habits and thereâ€™s bad rumors about her, but sometimes youâ€™ll see her in the same coffee shop as you and sit with her. have a nice chat about the good old days, and eventually you sleep with her, remembering how alive she made you feel. then the day after you wake up and look at her, you know sheâ€™s changed. she isnâ€™t who she was back then, and it probably will never go back to those good old days, but is it really that bad to check in once in a while and relive the glory days for a couple hours?
good game, as you can tell by all the people who have been playing it for 7 years and continue to play it despite babyraging constantly and leaving negative reviews

â€¢They originally said the game would drop with different modes such as PVE/Hero Mastery ETC.

Don't waste your time trying this game. blizzard and their loser of a ceo bobby kotick ruined it. OW2 promised a bunch of PVE content, but they knew it wasn't coming out BEFORE OW2 even went live and decided not to tell anyone. They lied to their player base, haven't fixed matchmaking, have mostly overpriced skins in the store, the "PVE" content they've just released is just a very minor upgrade to a feature that was removed from OW1, but now you have to pay for it. Don't give them your money, go buy Baldur's Gate 3 and give Larian Studios some love instead, They actually care about their players and have released a quality product.
Bad game, literally just a cash grab
Go to your mother's Bobby Curtic, go to your mother's Blizzard. Decades of companies have left behind only arrogance and sexual harassment. Expect Blizzard to die!

I've been Playing Overwatch for Years now, and despite their flaws, it was a fun game that's I would play quite frequently. Overwatch "2" feels like a chore with bare minimum rewards, unkept promises, way too overpriced skins, and strange match making that just drags this game down. It's honestly a real shame. Maybe it'll be fun again one day, but from the looks of it, this is going to stay a quick live service cash grab.
the characters just dont shut up is really fuking anoing

My dearest Overwatch, how I adored you from 2016 to about 2019 when Blizzard completely abandoned you. I stopped playing League of Legends and Dota for you, and I surely loved you more than Blizzard ever did. Unfortunately, Overwatch "2" is not the giant upgrade that was promised but a slight remaster with some new characters and maps. Sure you can play it for free, but loads of the content is locked behind battle passes or other pay walls. I downloaded it to reminisce about the good times I once had, and got a ton of achievements for it, so I guess there's that.
dice gratis pero para conseguier el eroe hay que terminar pass xd

Prefacing this by saying I, personally, never really cared about the PvE campaign. I was probably going to play it at some point, but what I mostly play the game for is the PvP, which I find very fun, so PvE not being rolled out the way it was promised has no impact on my opinion of the game we have, but for a very large number of people, the skill trees and such were extremely important, and the situation is a legitimate reason to dislike the game. There is still a PvE campaign-ish thing in the game as of Season 6, it just is not exactly what people expected. Final note on this, the PvE was always planned and advertised as a paid experience, not sure how people ended up thinking it was going to be free.

The handling of the professional Overwatch scene was very poor and also impacts a lot of people's opinion of the game. Overwatch can be a difficult game to watch, so combining that with bad management, is unfortunate (but also has no bearing on the actual gameplay).

I am a peak Masters player, so I have an OK idea of the game state, but I'm not a particularly amazing player, especially because I just play ranked occasionally now and squat in Gold and Platinum depending on role.
Overwatch is a fun and colorful hero shooter with goofy likeable characters that allow for a lot of skill expression for people with different play styles and skill sets. Team fights are chaotic and fun, and the average time-to-kill is quite long compared to traditional shooters, which is my personal preference. Every role has significant impact on the outcome of the game, however, not every Hero has the capability to win the game on their own.

I particularly like the amount of mobility options in the game, which is a deterrent for some people due to the increased emphasis on mechanical skill, I just find it fun! There are Heroes that don't require good aim and there are Heroes that don't require fast reflexes and keypresses. Most important, currently every Hero in the game is a viable option - despite what your team says (But team play is still more important than Hero viability). There are mains for every hero in Top 500 in every region, which somewhat, imperfectly, proves my point.

The transition to becoming a F2P Live Service game was a good move in my opinion because the additional cash flow should incentivize more frequent updates and balance changes, and so far has done exactly that. The price point for skins is in line with other F2P games, which means they are quite expensive. A complaint I have is that the seasonal battlepasses so far have not had currency in them to pay for future battlepasses, which is a practice many games with passes have. Placing Heroes in the battlepass, also, was a move I did not like, but they are on the free pass, and all of the Heroes are available through free missions after their debut season has passed.

To extend on this thought, I think the format of this game should have all Heroes unlocked for all players because of the importance of Hero swapping. A player starting the game today is at a legitimate disadvantage because of their limited Hero pool, until they finish unlocking them all. If the game changes to be even more MOBA-like and not have Hero swapping (like Paladins) then this system could be slightly more acceptable. As it stands, in my opinion, this is the biggest reason to not pick up the game if you don't plan to play long term.

The online community for this game is like every other online game - extremely toxic. There are bubbles of pleasant and nice people, but you usually have to seek them out. My recommendation, unfortunately, unless you are high rank and playing Competitive, is to not join voice chat and disable text chat if you have a sensitive disposition. I met my closest IRL friends through this game, so I know there are nice people who play the game. On the plus side, I report people constantly, and constantly receive notifications that the people I reported have been actioned on. Press the button liberally.

Other things about the game:
The Workshop is a powerful tool that has a dedicated community of players and creators keeping it fun and interesting. There are tons of fan-created modes and tons of people playing.
The Arcade is quite fun and silly (depending on rotation), but is unfortunately not incredibly popular. Sometimes, a particularly fun mode rolls through and has extremely fast queues.
Mystery Heroes and Deathmatch and alternative ways to play the game, which I find relaxing, especially compared to Competitive. Ever since Blizzard nerfed Tanks in non-role-lock queues, these modes have been much more enjoyable.
The Achievement system in this game is a particular soft spot for me. I am a completionist and love achievement hunting. This game is actually quite good for people like me. A downside, is many achievements are only available during specific events, so you may have to wait a long time for them if you are starting today.
Competitive is the central (but not most popular) mode in the game. In my opinion, there is not enough incentive to try to climb the ranked ladder. I own many golden guns, and what I gain out of Competitive is just more golden guns. Needs improvement. The temporary Competitive modes that Blizzard comes up with (like Mystery Heroes and LÃºcioball) are always super fun to me, but have very long queues due to being unpopular.

Conclusion: I really like this game, I find it very fun. My recommendation: The best way to enjoy this game, coming from a former competitive-only player, is grab a beer, get a group of friends together, queue Quick Play/Arcade/Workshop, and goof around.
buff Pharah and i will love the game FOREVER

As a dedicated player of Overwatch who has loved the game for many years, I am filled with anger and disappointment towards Blizzard's recent actions in the China region. Their series of unfair decisions make me question whether they genuinely care about players' interests and the quality of the game.

Blizzard, have you forgotten the original intention of Overwatch? It was a game centered around fairness, competitiveness, and teamwork. However, recently you have repeatedly made outrageous moves in the China region, clearly to cater to specific political and commercial interests.

Firstly, let's discuss game balance. You have made some unwise adjustments to hero abilities within the game, apparently to meet the demands of certain markets. This approach not only disrupts game balance but also leaves genuine players feeling disappointed and unsatisfied. Do you not realize that game balance is the key to sustaining players' enthusiasm?

Next, let's talk about your unjust treatment of Chinese players. In some instances, you have clearly taken a political stance rather than standing with players. You are willing to forsake core values in exchange for certain political and commercial gains, and this is simply unacceptable. Your betrayal of players, your departure from the essence of the game, has left us, the once-devoted Overwatch enthusiasts, extremely angry!

What's even more infuriating is your audacity to relaunch Overwatch on the Steam platform as if nothing has happened. Do you truly believe we will forget the multitude of unfair practices you engaged in previously? This hypocritical behavior only serves to expose your true nature, your disregard and betrayal of players, leaving us deeply disheartened!

Blizzard, you were once a respected game company, but now you have left a profound stain in our hearts. Your unjust actions and insincere behavior have unveiled your real face. As players, we should have the right to enjoy a fair and friendly gaming environment, rather than becoming pawns in your political and commercial games.

Finally, I must emphasize that Blizzard, you need to reflect and confront your mistakes. Your players are not tools to be manipulated but rather the driving force behind your development. I hope you can return to the right path, re-embrace the principle of player-centricity, and regain players' respect and support. Otherwise, your Overwatch is destined to lose even more genuine players. In the end, this world doesn't need Overwatch anymore!!! Reverse the negative momentum!!! Refund us!!!
It makes you feel like an Overwatch hero

I played OW1 a whole lot in high school. I played over a thousand matches and loved the game dearly. When OW2 was announced I was really excited for the new modes and the swap to 5v5. I even played in the OW2 Beta. That said, OW2 is a steaming pile of shit. They completely deleted the original game to swap to a new F2P model. They replaced the old system with an even more predatory monetization scheme (I don't know how you get more predatory than loot boxes but here we are). Furthermore, the whole reason OW2 was created was to focus on PVE (something the first game had but could have improved upon). Instead, they completely axed PVE. OW1 underwent 3 years with no updates only to be turned into a F2P cash grab game that wastes its player's time. It is so sad to see how far this franchise has fallen.
